title: How to Fold & Roll Up Panties: Thongs, Briefs & More

steps.title: Lay the panty vertically on a flat surface.
steps.content: Lay the panty vertically on a flat surface. Lay the panty with the front side facing up, and make sure one end of the waistband is closest to you. Run your hand over the fabric to smooth out any ripples or bumps. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the crotch of the panty up toward the waistband.
steps.content: Fold the crotch of the panty up toward the waistband. Pull the crotch area up until it meets the top of the waistband. The panty will be folded in half horizontally. [2] X Research source Run your hand over the fabric to ensure your panty is as flat as possible before rolling it.

steps.title: Roll the fabric horizontally across the panty.
steps.content: Roll the fabric horizontally across the panty. Start with the side that is closest to you and roll the fabric away from your body to make a tight cylinder. This will create a small, easily storable scroll. [3] X Research source This method works with thongs, but the size of the scroll will be much smaller than briefs and cheeky underwear once you finish folding it.

steps.title: Store the panty scrolls in a drawer or storage compartment.
steps.content: Store the panty scrolls in a drawer or storage compartment. Pack the scrolls side by side and position them vertically to save storage space. Organize them into a single layer so you can easily find what you’re looking for. If you don’t have much space, feel free to stack the pantry scrolls on top of each other.

steps.title: Lay the panty on a flat surface with the front facing up.
steps.content: Lay the panty on a flat surface with the front facing up. Position it so the crotch area is closest to you, and smooth your hand over the fabric to make sure the panty is as flat as possible. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the crotch up in the middle.
steps.content: Fold the crotch up in the middle. Pull the crotch area up so it meets the top of the waistband. Run your hand over the panty once more to flatten it as much as possible before you continue folding it. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Fold each side of the waistband inward to make a square.
steps.content: Fold each side of the waistband inward to make a square. Fold the left side of the panty into the center, then fold the right side on top of the left side to make a square shape. The panty will be folded into thirds. [6] X Research source This is the simplest and most compact method.

steps.title: Stack the panties vertically to store them.
steps.content: Stack the panties vertically to store them. Place them side by side and vertically inside your dresser or storage compartment. They will look like tiny files in a filing cabinet. If you want to organize them further, stack them by color, type, or occasion. You can now choose the pair you want without messing up the rest of them!

steps.title: Lay the panty front side up on a flat surface.
steps.content: Lay the panty front side up on a flat surface. Position the waistband so it’s closest to you. Run your hand over the panty to ensure it's as flat as possible before beginning the fold. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the waistband away from you 3 times.
steps.content: Fold the waistband away from you 3 times. Fold the fabric toward the crotch area, and roll the fabric as tight as possible. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the panty over so the rolled part is underneath.
steps.content: Flip the panty over so the rolled part is underneath. The panty will end up lying flat with the back side up and the crotch closest to you.

steps.title: Fold each side of the waistband towards the center.
steps.content: Fold each side of the waistband towards the center. Fold the right side into the middle, then repeat on the left side. The ends of each side of the waistband will end up overlapping each other. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the top of the panty toward you until it hits the crotch area.
steps.content: Roll the top of the panty toward you until it hits the crotch area. For larger types of panties, like briefs and boyshorts, fold the top twice on the way up. [10] X Research source This will create a distinct pocket inside the center of the folded panty. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the bundle inside out 3 times.
steps.content: Flip the bundle inside out 3 times. Place your thumbs inside the pocket and the rest of your fingers around the edges of the opening. Use your middle and index fingers to push the fabric along the back of the pocket up through the front opening, while folding the outside edges back with your thumbs. Repeat this until the bundle is rolled into itself 3 times. [12] X Research source You are essentially reversing the narrow waistband folds you made earlier in the process. Use this method if you don’t want your panties to unfold inside your drawer. This folding technique might look a little tricky, but think of it like you’re rolling a pair of crew socks into a ball.
